page.title: 15Pembroke Power Station Pt 1.
page.content: Pembroke Power Station was opened in 1971 built on land reclaimed from the sea,within the National Park area.It covers 480 acres and is the largest Welsh power station and one of the largest oil-fired stations in Europe.It can produce up to 2000 megawatts of electricity which is fed into the national grid.Being the most expensive to run, it is always the last one to be brought on line indeed we were told during our visit that it had not been used for three weeks.The reasons for it's use amused us a little,reasons such as the popularity of certain T.V. programmes (Coronation Street) which created very high demand.It's oil is supplied direct from 2 local refineries,Texaco and Gulf, the latter being directed by a submerged pipeline.The oil used is of a very low grade being thick and
